title: Renishaw profit collapse fuels fears of global slowdown
text:
Profits at engineering bellwether Renishaw have collapsed, raising fears about the prospects for the wider industry in the face of Brexit and a potential global trade war.

The FTSE 250 company, which makes measuring and calibration equipment, reported revenues of £124.6m in the three months to September, a fifth lower than in the same period last year. Profits plunged 85pc to £5.1m.

Investors were spooked by the news, with shares falling as much as 15pc before steadying down 10pc at 320p, wiping almost £400m off Renishaw’s value.

In the spring Renishaw warned its profits would be lower than expected, raising concerns for the global economy.

The company had suffered just seven earnings falls in...
description: Profits at engineering bellwether Renishaw have collapsed, raising fears about the prospects for the wider industry in the face of Brexit and a potential global trade war.
